```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(glue)
library(here)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
train <- readRDS(file.path(data_dir, 'processed_train.rds'))
test <- readRDS(file.path(data_dir, 'processed_test.rds'))
```

## 1. Check if there is any columns with only one value

```{r}
columns <- apply(train, 2, function(x) length(unique(x)))
column_names <- names(columns)

values <- tibble(
  'columns' = column_names,
  'num_unique_values' = columns %>% unname()
)
```
